definitions.definition: The part of a news program reporting on sports and athletics.
The underside of a roof that extends beyond the external walls of a building.
A vehicle for transporting objects into space, usually a rocket.
The opposite of a strike; a labor disruption where management refuses to allow workers into a plant to work even if they are willing.
The action of installing a lock to keep someone out of an area, such as eviction of a tenant by changing the lock.
(by extension) The exclusion of others from a certain place or situation.
definitions.example: It's another front-row lockout for Mercedes on the starting grid of the Japanese Grand Prix.

definitions.definition: A situation where the system is not responding to input.
A safety device designed to prevent touching a moving part when it is under operation.
The final portion of a weightlifting motion where all applicable limbs or joints are fully extended or "locked out".
An exercise meant to increase strength in the lockout portion of a lifting motion.
definitions.example: 2016, Christian Thibaudeau, “Tip: For Bigger Triceps, Do Heavy Lockouts”, T-Nation.

definitions.definition: To make a judgment (on a dispute) as an arbitrator or arbiter
definitions.example: to arbitrate a disputed case

definitions.definition: To submit (a dispute) to such judgment
To assign an arbitrary value to, or otherwise determine arbitrarily.
definitions.example: We wish to show f is continuous. Arbitrate epsilon greater than zero...

definitions.definition: The soft foot of a mammal or other animal, generally a quadruped, that has claws or nails; comparable to a human hand or foot.
A hand.
definitions.example: Get your grubby paws off my things!

definitions.definition: (of an animal) To go through something (such as a garbage can) with paws.
(of an animal) To gently push on something with a paw.
(of an animal) To draw the forefoot along the ground; to beat or scrape with the forefoot.
(by extension) To touch someone in a sexual way.
(by extension) To clumsily dig through something.
To flatter.
Father; pa.
Whole-wheat flour
(of bread or flour) containing or made from the whole grain, including the bran
A jet-propelled airliner.
A red-brown marmot, Marmota monax, native to North America.
The aardvark.
Abundant in growth or detail.
A small Arctic and Subarctic rodent from any of six genera of similar rodents.
Any member of a group given to conformity or groupthink, especially a group poised to follow a leader off a cliff.
Any of various small insects of the family Aleyrodidae that have long wings, and a white body; often a garden pest
A nightgown; female attire designed to be worn to bed.
definitions.example: She was too modest to come downstairs dressed only in her nightdress.

definitions.definition: An amphibian, a kind of frog (order Anura) with shorter hindlegs and a drier, wartier skin, many in family Bufonidae.
A contemptible or unpleasant person.
An ugly person.
To expel (a user) permanently from a MUD or similar system, so that their account is deleted.
The use of a single word to convey a complex idea.
A sunken area in front of a stage in which musicians, largely hidden from view, play music to accompany stage performances.
Of, characterized by, or preferring privacy and isolation; secluded.
An enclosed gear train.
That part of a car's transmission containing the train of gears, and to which the gear lever is connected.
Someone (or something) doomed; a hopeless case.
definitions.example: I'm a goner if this plan doesn't work.

definitions.definition: In the International System of Units, the base unit of mass; conceived of as the mass of one litre of water, but now defined by taking the fixed numerical value of the Planck constant h to be 6.626 070 15 × 10-34 when expressed in units of kg⋅m2⋅s−1. Symbol: kg
The unit of weight such that a one-kilogram mass is also a one-kilogram weight.
A weasel-like animal of the genus Mustela.
A skunk.
A tubular device used to support lights on a set.
The tube through which urine exits the body and, in penises, through which semen is ejaculated.
(grammar) A clause that can stand alone syntactically as a complete sentence; contains at least a subject and a verb.
To have a given result; to turn out (well, badly etc.); to result in.
To happen as a result; to come about.
Using the power of the military.
Related to the use of the military.
An empty space; a vacuum.
definitions.example: Nobody has crossed the void since one man died trying three hundred years ago; it's high time we had another go.

definitions.definition: An extended region of space containing no galaxies
A collection of adjacent vacancies inside a crystal lattice.
A pocket of vapour inside a fluid flow, created by cavitation.
An empty space between floors or walls, including false separations and planned gaps between a building and its facade.
To make invalid or worthless.
definitions.example: He voided the check and returned it.

definitions.definition: To empty.
definitions.example: void one’s bowels

definitions.definition: To throw or send out; to evacuate; to emit; to discharge.
definitions.example: to void excrement

definitions.definition: To withdraw, depart.
To remove the contents of; to make or leave vacant or empty; to quit; to leave.
definitions.example: to void a table

definitions.definition: Containing nothing; empty; not occupied or filled.
Having no incumbent; unoccupied; said of offices etc.
Being without; destitute; devoid.
Not producing any effect; ineffectual; vain.
Of no legal force or effect, incapable of confirmation or ratification.
Containing no immaterial quality; destitute of mind or soul.
(of a function or method) That does not return a value.
A voidee.

The length of a single cycle of a wave, as measured by the distance between one peak or trough of a wave and the next; it is often designated in physics as λ, and corresponds to the velocity of the wave divided by its frequency.
To swindle someone by not paying a debt, especially a gambling debt.
A South Asian dessert made from milk solids that are deep-fried and soaked in syrup.
Worthy of respect; respectable.

A courtesy title, given in Britain and the Commonwealth to a cabinet minister, minister of state, or senator, and in the United States to the president, vice president, congresspeople, state governors and legislators, and mayors.
Extremely angry; wrathful; enraged.
A government consisting of a coalition of three or more parties, particularly parties with divergent ideologies.
The act of remembering; a holding in mind, or bringing to mind; recollection.
The state of being remembered, or held in mind; memory, recollection.
Something remembered; a person or thing kept in memory.
That which serves to keep in or bring to mind; a memento, a memorial, a souvenir, a token; a memorandum or note of something to be remembered.
The power of remembering; the reach of personal knowledge; the period over which one's memory extends.
Something to be remembered; an admonition, counsel, instruction.
On or in a means of transportation.
definitions.example: Baby on board

definitions.definition: Joining in or participating.
definitions.example: Is that new teammate properly on board yet?

definitions.definition: Agreeing or supporting.
definitions.example: It’s a good idea, but let’s see if we can get a few more of the management team on board.

definitions.definition: Into itself or oneself.
On a vehicle or vessel; aboard.
A decorative and protective disk that covers the hub of a motor car wheel
A cocktail made with gin or vodka and vermouth.
definitions.example: My boss is out on another of his three-martini lunches.

definitions.definition: (sometimes proscribed) Any cocktail served in a cocktail glass, often sweet or fruity and aimed at women.
definitions.example: I love the chocolate martinis at Trendy Bar!

definitions.definition: A person who lives in self-imposed isolation or seclusion from the world, especially for religious purposes; a hermit
The place where a recluse dwells; a place of isolation or seclusion
A brown recluse spider
To shut; to seclude
Sequestered; secluded, isolated
definitions.example: a recluse monk or hermit

definitions.definition: Hidden, secret
Any of several small North American rodents, of the genus Neotoma, that have bushy tails.
One who collects or hoards, especially unnecessary things.
The woman who gives birth to a child (not necessarily the genetic mother)
A stone or metal flat plate or surface on which food is fried or baked.
To use a griddle, cook on a griddle
The smallest possible amount of matter which still retains its identity as a chemical element, now known to consist of a nucleus surrounded by electrons.
(history of science) A hypothetical particle posited by Greek philosophers as an ultimate and indivisible component of matter.
The smallest, indivisible constituent part or unit of something.
In logical atomism, a fundamental fact that cannot be further broken down.
The smallest medieval unit of time, equal to fifteen ninety-fourths of a second.
A mote of dust in a sunbeam.
A very small amount; a whit.
(Lisp) An individual number or symbol, as opposed to a list; a scalar value.
A non-zero member of a Boolean algebra that is not a union of any other elements. Or, a non-zero member of a Boolean lattice that has only zero below it.
definitions.example: In a Venn diagram, an atom is depicted as an area circumscribed by lines but not cut by any line.

definitions.definition: An element of a set that is not itself a set; an urelement.
(usually capitalised as "Atom") A member of an age group division in hockey for ten- to 11-year-olds.
The frontmost edge of a wing or other airfoil of an aircraft; sometimes contains slots or slats
(by extension) The foremost part of a trend etc; a vanguard
At the forefront of practice or technology, contrast with bleeding edge
To ride a bike.
definitions.example: I biked so much yesterday that I'm very sore today.

definitions.definition: To travel by bike.
definitions.example: It was such a nice day I decided to bike to the store, though it's far enough I usually take my car.

definitions.definition: To transport by bicycle
The sport of riding a bicycle.
definitions.example: Professional biking is plagued with controversies over drug use.

definitions.definition: The practice of riding a motorcycle.
A strong wind carrying clouds of sand and dust through the air.
A limit that when surpassed cannot be returned from, or an action that when taken cannot be reversed.
Especially in bezique and piquet: a score which, if not achieved by a losing player, increases the player's penalty.
Especially in bezique and piquet: to defeat a player who has not achieved the rubicon.
An inflammation of the bronchi of the lungs, that causes the cilia of the bronchial epithelial cells to stop functioning.
An occurrence of, a case (patient) of, or a type of bronchitis.
A retail outlet that is one of a group of similar establishments having common format, contents, ownership and management.
The illegal buying or selling of securities of a publicly held company by a person who has privileged access to information concerning the company's financial condition or plans.
(usually uncountable) The skin or outer layer of a fruit, vegetable, etc.
The action of peeling away from a formation.
A cosmetic preparation designed to remove dead skin or to exfoliate.
To remove the skin or outer covering of.
definitions.example: I sat by my sister's bed, peeling oranges for her.

definitions.definition: To remove something from the outer or top layer of.
definitions.example: I peeled (the skin from) a banana and ate it hungrily.

definitions.definition: To become detached, come away, especially in flakes or strips; to shed skin in such a way.
definitions.example: I had been out in the sun too long, and my nose was starting to peel.

definitions.definition: To remove one's clothing.
definitions.example: The children peeled by the side of the lake and jumped in.

definitions.definition: To move, separate (off or away).
definitions.example: The scrum-half peeled off and made for the touchlines.

definitions.definition: A stake.
A fence made of stakes; a stockade.
A small tower, fort, or castle; a keep.
A shovel or similar instrument, now especially a pole with a flat disc at the end used for removing pizza or loaves of bread from a baker's oven.
A T-shaped implement used by printers and bookbinders for hanging wet sheets of paper on lines or poles to dry.
The blade of an oar.
An equal or match; a draw.
A takeout which removes a stone from play as well as the delivered stone.
To play a peel shot.
To send through a hoop (of a ball other than one's own).
To plunder; to pillage, rob.
A small salmon; a grilse; a sewin.
A communications system consisting of a network of teletypewriters.
A message sent through such a network.
The machine used to send and receive such messages.
To send (a message) by telex.
A short description of a book, film, or other work, written and used for promotional purposes.
To write or quote in a blurb.
To supply with a blurb.
A hot sandwich consisting of a patty of cooked ground beef or a meat substitute, in a sliced bun, sometimes also containing salad vegetables, condiments, or both.
The patty used in such a sandwich.
Ground beef, especially that intended to be made into hamburgers.
(somewhat crude) An animal or human, or the flesh thereof, that has been badly injured as a result of an accident or conflict.
definitions.example: I'm going to make you into hamburger if you do that again.

definitions.definition: A hamburger button.
A sudden pull.
Any of various knots used to attach a rope to an object other than another rope.
A fastener or connection point, as for a trailer.
definitions.example: His truck sported a heavy-duty hitch for his boat.

definitions.definition: A problem, delay or source of difficulty.
definitions.example: The banquet went off without a hitch

definitions.definition: A hidden or unfavorable condition or element; a catch.
definitions.example: The deal sounds too good to be true. What's the hitch?

definitions.definition: A period of time spent in the military.
definitions.example: She served two hitches in Vietnam.

definitions.definition: To pull with a jerk.
definitions.example: She hitched her jeans up and then tightened her belt.

definitions.definition: To attach, tie or fasten.
definitions.example: He hitched the bedroll to his backpack and went camping.

definitions.definition: To marry oneself to; especially to get hitched.
Contraction of hitchhike, to thumb a ride.
definitions.example: to hitch a ride

definitions.definition: To become entangled or caught; to be linked or yoked; to unite; to cling.
To move interruptedly or with halts, jerks, or steps; said of something obstructed or impeded.
To strike the legs together in going, as horses; to interfere.
Any of several North American plane trees, of the genus Platanus, especially Platanus occidentalis (American sycamore).
A large British and European species of maple, Acer pseudoplatanus, known in North America as the sycamore maple.
A large tree bearing edible fruit, Ficus sycomorus, allied to the common fig and found in Egypt and Syria; also called the sycamore fig or the fig-mulberry; the Biblical sycomore.
An Islamic garment that covers the whole body, which has a net screen covering the eyes so they cannot be seen, and is worn by women.
A dress made from felt or karakul (the short curly fur of young lambs of the breed of that name), traditionally worn by men of the Caucasus region.
A police officer, especially a junior officer assigned patrol duty instead of detection or supervision.
To kasher; to prepare (for example, meat) in conformity with the requirements of the Jewish law.
Fit for use or consumption, in accordance with Jewish law (especially relating to food).
definitions.example: David's mother kept a kosher kitchen, with separate sets of dishes for meat and for dairy.

definitions.definition: (by extension) In accordance with standards or usual practice.
definitions.example: Is what I have done kosher with Mr. Smith?

definitions.definition: In a kosher manner; in accordance with kashrut.
A person who scores a goal, or scores goals
A helicopter.
To helicopter: to transport by helicopter.
To helicopter: to travel by helicopter.
To move like a helicopter.
Fast, rapid, speedy.
Service in an army or other military organisation, whether as a chosen job or as a result of an involuntary draft (conscription).
A unit of weight for precious stones and pearls, equivalent to 200 milligrams.
Any of several units of weight, varying from 189 to 212 mg, the weight of a carob seed.
A measure of the purity of gold, pure gold being 24 carats.
A tool with a heavy head and a handle used for pounding.
definitions.example: Bobby used a hammer and nails to fix the two planks together

definitions.definition: The act of using a hammer to hit something}}
definitions.example: The nail is too loose - give it a hammer.

definitions.definition: A moving part of a firearm that strikes the firing pin to discharge a gun.
The malleus, a small bone of the middle ear.
In a piano or dulcimer, a piece of wood covered in felt that strikes the string.
definitions.example: The sound the piano makes comes from the hammers striking the strings

definitions.definition: A device made of a heavy steel ball attached to a length of wire, and used for throwing.
The last stone in an end.
(frisbee) A frisbee throwing style in which the disc is held upside-down with a forehand grip and thrown above the head.
Part of a clock that strikes upon a bell to indicate the hour.
One who, or that which, smites or shatters.
definitions.example: St. Augustine was the hammer of heresies.

definitions.definition: To strike repeatedly with a hammer, some other implement, the fist, etc.
definitions.example: Tony hammered on the door to try to get him to open.

definitions.definition: To form or forge with a hammer; to shape by beating.
To emphasize a point repeatedly.
To hit particularly hard.
To ride very fast.
To strike internally, as if hit by a hammer.
definitions.example: I could hear the engine’s valves hammering once the timing rod was thrown.

definitions.definition: To defeat (a person, a team) resoundingly
definitions.example: We hammered them 5-0!

definitions.definition: To make high demands on (a system or service).
To declare (a person) a defaulter on the stock exchange.
To beat down the price of (a stock), or depress (a market).
To have hard sex with
definitions.example: Daniel hammered Mary til he came.

definitions.definition: A wealthy person.
A small elasticated ring of fabric placed around long hair to hold it in place behind the head.
Scrunched up; creased or wrinkled
Language, particularly written language, not intended as poetry.
definitions.example: Though known mostly for her prose, she also produced a small body of excellent poems.

definitions.definition: Language which evinces little imagination or animation; dull and commonplace discourse.
A hymn with no regular meter, sometimes introduced into the Mass.
To write or repeat in a dull, tedious, or prosy way.
A facility with exercise equipment, and sometimes instructors, open to the public or those on some membership list.
(familiar) mother.
An adult female owner of a pet.
To care in a motherly way.
A very small piece of matter, a fragment; especially, the smallest possible part of something.
Any of various physical objects making up the constituent parts of an atom; an elementary particle or subatomic particle.
A word that has a particular grammatical function but does not obviously belong to any particular part of speech, such as the word to in English infinitives or O as a vocative particle.
A part of speech which cannot be inflected: an adverb, preposition, conjunction or interjection.
In the Roman Catholic church, a crumb of consecrated bread; also the smaller breads used in the communion of the laity.
A function on some telephones allowing a phone number to be dialed by pressing only one or two keys.
A web browser feature that displays frequently or recently visited websites for quick access.
A rectangular, hard, dry biscuit
A twice-baked bread, slices of bread baked until they are hard and crisp (also called a zwieback)
A weaning food for children
A cereal binder used in meat product manufacture
The collected readers of a publication.
definitions.example: The village newspaper has a readership of only 200 people.

definitions.definition: The role or office of a reader.
definitions.example: the Nora Chadwick Readership in Celtic Studies

definitions.definition: The transportation of troops, civilians or supplies by air, especially in an emergency.
Such a flight.
A pipe that is used to suck up objects from the sea bed.
To transport (troops etc) in an airlift.
Panthera pardus, a large wild cat with a spotted coat native to Africa and Asia, especially the male of the species (in contrast to leopardess).
(inexact) A similar-looking, large wild cat named after the leopard.
A lion passant guardant.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the genus Phalanta, having black markings on an orange base.
To put oneself in a precarious situation with a high risk of getting harmed, particularly emotionally or financially.
definitions.example: I'm telling you, if you sign that paper, you're playing with fire.
